feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
05/13 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-sixth edition:

Laura:
  • Dash - Offline API documentation sets
  • npwd - Command-line password management for your various accounts
  • Night of Support - Some shameless promotion! Night of Support is coming this Friday to a sektor5 near you.
Aaron:
  • Faster Search with PostgreSQL - A really straight forward way to increase search performance using PostgreSQL’s full text search and the JSON data type
  • Why Rails 5 / Turbolinks 3.0 / Action Cable matter, and why @dhh was right all along - Controversial article about Rails 5’s new set of features. Also a good intro to Rails 5’s new features.
Floor:
  • RubyThursday - Build a portfolio in a fun and engaging way. What if you had access to a set of fresh Ruby on Rails projects and tutorials that helped you consistently code on a regular basis?
  • Atom for Rails - Setting up Atom for Rails Development
  • Upset baby in pure CSS - thihihi.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
05/06 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-fifth edition:

Laura:
  • Gitignore - A collection of useful gitignore templates
  • What’s your least favourite thing about Ruby? - because sometimes, just sometimes, we have to go there
Floor:
  • FizzBuzz Pro - Solving the FizzBuzz test without a single If statement
  • Not just unicode - How to store emoji in a Rails app with a MySQL database
  • Rails on Codecademy - Codecademy added a course on Ruby on Rails 4. By the end of the course, you’ll be able to use Ruby on Rails to create your own apps.
Gerald:
  • Ruby Performance Optimization: Why Ruby Is Slow, and How to Fix It - New (Beta) Book in the Pragmatic Programmers Ruby Series
  • Awesome Markdown - Yet another awesome collection on GitHub about all things Markup and Markdown
  • Linuxwochen Wien @ FH Technikum, May/7-9 - New Event in Vienna; Free; Everyone Welcome
  • Introducing datapak - Work with Tabular Data Packages using Ruby and ActiveRecord - Article about Working w/ Open Data and SQL(ite) in Ruby

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
04/29 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-fourth edition:

Laura:
  • thef*ck - magnificent app which corrects your previous console command
  • railsdiff - View diff of app configuration for different Rails versions
  • Contributing to Open Source projects - Alex Williams wrote a short recap of last weekend’s ROSSConf on his blog
Floor:
  • Picture proof - Can’t help but falling in love with the gorgeous pictures Manuel Gruber took at ROSS Conf
  • ROSS Conf decks - We collected the slides from ROSS Conf for you to relive the good times

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
04/22 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-third edition:

Laura:
  • Estimating time for web projects more accurately - in spite of it being really old, this article is a pretty good overview of how to somewhat accurately estimate web projects.
  • 12 resolutions for programmers - Challenge yourself with a new, month-sized, resolution every month.
  • Existing HTML rel values - Entertaining to see how many strange rel values exist in HTML (hashtag: crush)
Floor:
  • Sublime 3.0 - This is a pick for Laura; setting up Sublime Text 3 for Ruby Development.
  • Arrrrcamp CFP is open - Because speaking at ArrrrCamp is arrrrsome!
  • awesome events - Gerald collects awesome (Ruby related) events in his awesome events repo.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
04/15 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the one-hundred-second edition:

Laura:
  • 10 years of Git - Git turns ten years old this month!
  • Potter API - Just what it sounds like: A Harry Potter API.
  • Markdown Processing in Ruby - A look at four different Ruby implementations of Markdown
Floor:
  • Awesome Ruby - A collection of awesome Ruby libraries, tools, frameworks and software, sorted alphabetically.
  • Ruby Rogues #202 - The Struggles New Ruby Users Have with Jake Day Williams
Gerald:
  • New Book: Ruby Cookbook, 2nd Edition - A massive collection of Ruby recipes (1000+ pages) e.g. cook yourself an API service w/ Sinatra, and much more. Free sample chapter on “What’s News in Ruby 2.1”.
  • Jekyll on Rails - add Jekyll - a static site generator - to your Rails app; step by step instructions incl. how-to-use Rails-like asset pipeline in Jekyll
  • Free Event: Ruby Meetup in Linz, Upper Austria - why not visit Linz and join this year’s first Ruby Meetup in Upper Austria on May 20th at the AXIS Coworking Loft?
